title: If the universe was created from a singularity, is it fair to say that new space and time are always being created? - Quora

response.answer_text: Absolutely. At the “Planck time” instant of the Big Bang explosion, Space began expanding outward. Time also was created at the same time the “new” Space was created. The so-called “Dark Energy” is responsible fore expanding “Space” of the Universe. It is my hypothesis that “Dark Energy” was/is the result of the Big Bang explosion, by creating two three-dimensional pressure waves that “stretched” and expanded Space. Time is the human measurement of the expansion. It continues as a part of Space, and therefore we have Space/Time. But Time is NOT a dimension, it is a measurement.  Times travels along all three dimensions, as Space expands, the measurement of time ticks away. As long as there is Space, time will exist. However, by my hypothesis, Space will eventually slow down. Mainly because the expansion of the Universe “requires” work energy to be expended to continually “stretch” Space by “Dark Energy.” Since this “Dark Energy” does have a finite amount of energy to expend, this energy will continue to be consumed doing the work of expansion until the “Dark Energy” will finally be used up. Just saying……

Yes, it’s fair to say that although I would not say space and time are always being created as space and time are metrics that measure real things (distances, rates of actions) but themselves are words that refer to the mathematical measuring tools that makes them metrics; they are not substances or forces themselves. Cosmologists don’t believe that there was a singularity in the beginning, just a very dense, hot state. Laws of physics tend to not work when taken to an extreme. Rolling back the expansion to a singularity is on such extreme, which is one reason they don’t believe in it. Another reason is that eternal inflation is a favored model (google it), where our Big Bang is a bubble in an eternally inflating greater context.

Space and speed-time get destroyed, not created. Space is made up of positive and negative elements just as is matter. When it breaks up, it becomes chaotic, causing it to rift. Repelling clusters are like rifts between tectonic plates.
No, because it was only ever an Expansion of Space then no Space existed in the first place, and hence none exists now. BIg Bang is an illusion worthy of the Magic Circle.
